III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/11/23, youth was found walking in the street without shoes
or proper winter clothing. Youth also had a bruise on the left eye.
Youth's lip was cut open and they had various bruises on their
hands and the inside of the arms and legs. On 12/11/23, there
was an altercation at the facility between 4 youth. Youth goes
AWOL often and there are concerns that the protocols in place to
prevent and address AWOL are not followed or effective.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
12/12/2023.
I interviewed the complainant via telephone on 12/12/2023. No
additional information was provided.
I interviewed Director at the agency on 12/13/2023. Director reported
on 12/11/2023 Youth A was escalated due to having a pocketknife
confiscated earlier in the day. He exited the cabin without his
shoes, Staff 1 tried to get him to return, he called Staff 1 "Niggers",
threw sticks, and bit Staff 1. He said Youth B got triggered by what
Youth A was saying and physically assaulted Youth A. There were
several staff members who immediately intervened and separated
the two boys. He said Youth C and Youth D were outside, but they
did not engage physically with Youth A. Director followed Youth A
for 45 minutes before calling for another staff to take over. He said
Youth A is very challenging and when he does not get his way he
is very aggressive. Director reported there are several youths that
frequently AWOL and the protocol is always followed. The
protocol is If youths AWOL but stay on campus and go into the
woods, staff should contact the supervisor, follow calmly on foot, and
verbally attempt to return them to campus. Staff must follow youths
as far as possible without endangering the youth or their own safety.
If youths retreat further into the woods and staff lose eyesight of
them, the police should be contacted, and a missing persons reports
filed.
I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 12/13/2023. Youth A was
observed to have a bruise under his right eye. Youth A reported he
got into a fight with Youth B on 12/11/2023. He said this happened
while they were playing outside. He said the staff were outside and
they stopped the fight. He admitted to AWOLing after the fight. He
reported staff followed him and he eventually returned to campus
with the staff. Youth A reported he was not wearing his shoes,
because he ran out of the cottage without his shoes. Youth A
admitted he has several pairs of shoes, and a coat. Youth A said
staff did take him to urgent care after the fight and he was examined
2

by a doctor. He denied staff did anything to hurt him and he further
denied biting or hitting staff. He was asked what happens when he
gets into trouble, and he said staff take away privileges. Youth A did
not express any concerns about staff.
I interviewed Youth B at the agency on 12/13/2023. Youth B reported
he has been at the agency for 5 years and has no concerns
regarding staff or the agency. Youth B said on 12/11/2023 he was
outside with staff, he observed Youth A hitting staff with a stick and
calling them the “n” word. He said that upset him, so he ran up to
Youth A and punched him in the face. He said staff separated them
and that’s when Youth A bit Staff 2’s hand. He denied being injured
during the fight.
I interviewed Youth C at the agency on 12/14/2023. Youth C reported
he was outside on 12/11/2023, and he witnessed Youth A hitting and
throwing sticks at staff, cursing, and calling staff the “n” word. He saw
Youth A and B get into a physical fight and staff separated the two
youths. He denied being involved or seeing any other youth involved.
and Youth B fighting. Youth C reported he has clothes, shoes, and a
coat.
I attempted to interview Youth D at the agency on 12/14/2023, but he
refused to be interviewed.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the agency on 12/14/2023. Staff 1 reported on
12/11/2023 Director called and requested he follow Youth A down 6-
Mile Road. He said Youth A had AWOLed after getting into a fight
with Youth B. He got the van and followed Youth A until Youth A
eventually agreed to get in the van with him. Staff 1 transported Youth
A to the urgent care for a physical exam. He said Youth A has a
difficult time with being told what to do and when he is triggered, he
AWOLs. He said when youths AWOL, staff follow them, contact the
supervisor, and verbally attempt to return them to campus. He said
staff follow youths as far as possible without endangering their own
safety. If staff lose eyesight of the youth, then a police report is filed
and when a youth returns to campus police are notified.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the agency on 12/14/2023. Staff 2 reported on
12/11/2023, she and Youth B were outside, Youth A was escalated
and being physically aggressive with Staff 3, cursing and using the
“n” word. Staff 3 was trying to verbally deescalate Youth A. She said
Youth B got triggered by Youth A and they got into a physical fight.
She and Staff 3 separated the two boys, and that’s when Youth A bit
her hand. She said Youth A then ran off and Director followed Youth
A off campus.
3

I interviewed Staff 3 at the agency. Staff 3 is a Youth Specialist and
has been working at the facility for 10 years. Staff 3 was outside with
Youth A on 12/11/2023 and was attempting to verbally deescalate
Youth A. He said Youth A attempted to hit him with a stick and was
calling him and Youth B the “n” word. He said that triggered Youth B
and that’s when Youth A and Youth A got into a physical altercation.
He and Staff 2 separated the two boys and that’s when Youth A bit
Staff 2’s hand. Staff 3 said Youth A was still escalated and AWOLed.
He said the Director was called and assisted by following Youth A.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Worker via telephone on
12/15/2023. Foster Care Worker reported she met with Youth A
today and he told her that he was involved in a physical altercation
with another youth on 12/11/2023 and got punched in the eye. She
said the agency does a good job in reference to notifying her and
keeping her updated on his behavior and AWOLs. She expressed no
concerns regarding the agency.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident report dated 11/21/2023 completed by Staff 1.
Report noted Youth A self-triggered, ran out of the cottage,
and ran through the woods behind the cottage. Staff
followed until line of sight was lost. Staff filed AWOL police
report #23-2558. Youth A returned to campus on 11/24/2023.
• Incident report dated 11/25/2023 completed by Staff 2.
Reported Youth A was triggered because he wanted to go
outside and AWOLed when staff told him he could not go
outside.
• Incident report dated 11/26/2023 completed by Staff 3.
Property destruction, physical aggression, verbal
aggression/threatening language, and AWOL. The report
stated Youth A was in bathroom with a sharp object. Youth
attempted to stab Staff 3 with the sharp object, tried to take
the mirror off the wall and broke a light cover in the
bathroom, and ran out of the cottage. The police were
contacted, and a police report completed. The staff and
youths were not injured, and no restraint was utilized.
• Incident report date 12/11/2023 completed by Staff 3.
Youth A was escalated, staff attempted to talk and verbally
deescalate, but Youth A spit and hit Staff 3 with a stick,
Youth A started cursing at staff and calling them the “n”
word. Youth B approached Youth A and they got into a
physical altercation. Staff 2 and Staff 3 separated the two
youths, and that’s when Youth A bit staff 2.
• Incident report date 12/11/2023 completed by Staff 2. Type
of incident; AWOL, physical aggression, minor injury, and
4

left arear without permission. Youth A left the cottage
without permission and walked up to 6 Mile Road.
• Medical assessment for Youth A, dated 12/11/2023,
completed by Med Care Urgent Care. Youth A was
examined due to be involved in a fist fight. Exam was
normal.
• Facility’s AWOL policy. Staff are expected to make all efforts
to maintain eyesight of the youth(s). If youths leave the
grounds, staff should get a van and follow them. If youths
AWOL but stay on campus and go into the woods, staff
should contact the supervisor, follow calmly on foot, and
verbally attempt to return them. Staff must follow youths as far
as possible without endangering their own safety. If youths
retreat further into the woods and staff lose eyesight of them,
the police should be contacted, a missing person’s report
filed, and when a youth returns to campus notify police.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentations reviewed,
Youth A was involved in a fight with another youth, Staff
intervened, and Youth A attempted to AWOL. Youth A has
extensive history for AWOLing, documentation and staff interviews
confirmed staff followed facility’s policy regarding Youth A going
AWOL.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
